text: Came to Lai Huat Signature for their famous sambal fish and it didn’t disappoint! The meaty promfret was fried to perfection and that shiok sambal paired so well with rice. Also had their crispy garlic pork, rich fish maw with crab meat soup and braised beancurd skin with kailan. Solid dishes for a hearty meal!

We indulged in a few signature dishes at Lai Huat:

✅ Sambal Promfret – crispy, golden perfection topped with their iconic spicy sambal that packs a punch. So satisfying!

✅ Braised Beancurd Skin Kai Lan – tender beancurd skin in a rich, savory sauce, paired with fresh crunchy greens

✅ Garlic Pork – flavorful, juicy, crispy pork tossed in fragrant garlic.

✅Fish Maw with Crab Meat Soup – Rich and comforting - full of smooth fish maw and crab

Come here for the legendary Sambal Promfret Fish. Heard is over 1 MILLION servings sold

Let's talk about the Lai Huat Sambal Fish. It’s deep-fried pomfret topped with a fragrant homemade sambal chili. So shiok is an understatement. Trust me, it’s a must-try.

the Fragrant Pork Ribs with Garlic—a dish that perfectly balance crunch and juicy

Fish Maw with Crab Meat Soup
So rich, comforting that combines delicate fish maw and sweet crab meat in a silky broth that feels like a warm hug.

Braised Beancurd Skin with Kai Lan
Light yet flavorful that offers a delicious balance of textures, with the beancurd skin absorbing all the savory flavoyrs in the sauce.

What we tried:
- 驰名叁芭鲳鱼 $35
Famous Sambal Pomfret Fish - this needs to be a Must try. It’s a good food beneath the layer of delish sambal.
- 豆根芥兰 $16/$24 - very yummy, the Seitan knot was very special & big with a nice chew to it
Braised Beancurd Skin with Kai Lan
- 蒜香炸肉 $15 / $25
Garlic Pork - crispy & fragrant with a good hint of garlic
- 蟹肉鱼鳔羮 $20 / $35 / $45
Fish Maw with Crab Meat Soup - Medium thick consistency that tasted good with generous amount of ingredients

Do also check out their affordable 超值午餐套餐VALUE LUNCH MENU too!

Everything we had was delicious & well-prepared—I do recommend trying them if you visit! Plenty of affordable parking spaces just a few steps away. Giant ceiling fan to you cool!

Sambal used to be more fragrant and tasty, fish was abit over fried too. The price for the fish is quite high, $35 for that fish.

Har cheong gai and garlic nai bai was good though.
